page.title: 12EDUCATION
page.content: Education in the Landulph & Botus Fleming Parishes started sometime in the 18th Century, in a room in a house on the Pentillie Estate, owned by the Coryton family. The famous astronomer John Couch Adams, discoverer of the planet Neptune, was educated there in the early 19th Century. Later in this century the Church of England built a school in the Parish. In the early part of the 20th Century the State took over the provision of education in the Parish and in 1920 an all-age school was built on its present site. This was a Board School of that time. After the Butler Act of 1944, the school became a County Primary catering for the needs of children, aged 4 to 11, in the Landulph and Botus Fleming Parishes, together with outlying districts.
